confession.devil_appearance: hands like paws of bear, feet like those of horse
confession.seduction_context: husband beat her saying everyone said she was witch; went to lament behind house and Persin approached
sabbat_activities: banquet without bread wine or salt
adoration of great devil on horse

witnesses.name: Jean de Gonville
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation before marriage 18 years ago. Late wife Fleuratte believed Mengette caused her death 9 years ago. Mengette visited day before wife died.

witnesses.name: Demenge Mareschal
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation only.

witnesses.name: Jehenne femme Demenge Didier Ydatte
witnesses.testimony_summary: Son Blaise aged 3 fell ill after Mengette passed hand over him. Daughter told story of dancing with calves and black dogs 8 years ago.

witnesses.name: Sebille femme Jean Belat
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation 26 years. Unable to work 7 weeks, daughter unable to walk 12 weeks. Believed revenge for action against Mengette's mother Laurence.

witnesses.name: Jean Choion le viel
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation more than 10 years.

witnesses.name: Anthoine Brocquelat
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation since youth. Fine foal became blind previous year after they envied it.

witnesses.name: Jean Vannier
witnesses.testimony_summary: Foal died after husband admired it. Cow became ill 3 years earlier after Mengette admired it, recovered after 7-8 weeks.

witnesses.name: Demenge Purel
witnesses.testimony_summary: Horse went lame after Jean Cachette remarked on good horses. Mengette offered grease to cure it, horse recovered. Foal died full of venom.

witnesses.name: Dieudonnée femme Jean Vannier
witnesses.testimony_summary: Repeated husband's stories about cow losing milk and foal dying after Jean Cachette touched it with serpette.

witnesses.name: Nicolle femme Demenge Purel
witnesses.testimony_summary: Repeated husband's story about sick horse treated with grease from accused, and foal that died.

witnesses.name: Jean Guerin
witnesses.testimony_summary: Stepson struck her cow 12 years ago, became ill, cured by soup made with bread and salt from her house. Lost cow after husband prosecuted for wood theft.

witnesses.name: Nicolas Harman
witnesses.testimony_summary: Two horses died 6-7 years ago after quarrel over grain for damage done by their horses. Told her she should be burned.

witnesses.name: Claude Harman
witnesses.testimony_summary: Horse sickened 5 years ago after dispute with husband over ploughing damage. Threatened to burn her or beat her if she didn't cure it.

witnesses.name: Jean de Frambois
witnesses.testimony_summary: Heard her called witch by Claudine, servant to vicaire, 2.5 years ago. Husband did not seek redress.

witnesses.name: Claude Moictrier
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation 12 years.

witnesses.name: Jehenne veuve Jean Deran
witnesses.testimony_summary: Daughter Claudette in service to accused, got pain in thigh after witness refused to sell pears. Recovered when returned to service. Cow died, daughter Jehenne broke leg.

witnesses.name: Jehenne femme Michiel Hanry
witnesses.testimony_summary: Mother believed Mengette caused her death, had touched her near feet 2-3 days before death.

witnesses.name: Jean Mengin
witnesses.testimony_summary: Guarded her mother at Azerailles. Mother instructed him to tell Mengette and husband to leave Flin, fearing their arrest.

witnesses.name: Bernard Didier Symonin
witnesses.testimony_summary: When mother was in prison, Mengette begged him to tell her if mother confessed. He chased her away.

witnesses.name: Dieudonné Demenge Alix
witnesses.testimony_summary: Lost 2 horses in second year of ploughing arrangement with her father-in-law. Believed she caused death of wife and son aged 3 from envy.

witnesses.name: Anthoine Vannier
witnesses.testimony_summary: Sent her son Bartremin home after week. Cow died suddenly, wife quarrelled with her calling her witch. Had persistent illness, cured by eating bread/salt/yeast from her house.

witnesses.name: Jean Grand Jean
witnesses.testimony_summary: Wife refused lard before mother's detention. Wife fell ill 3 years later, lost voice after eating plums from Mengette, recovered after eating apples from her.

witnesses.name: Jean Bocquel
witnesses.testimony_summary: Found their horses in meadow 7 years ago, took one home demanding pledge. Found 3 piglets dead next day after wife returned cauldron.

witnesses.name: Claudon le Court
witnesses.testimony_summary: Heard she was suspected but knew nothing against her.

witnesses.name: Catherine femme Jean Purel le charier
witnesses.testimony_summary: Lived next to her 16-18 years ago. Obtained bread and salt for Jean Marechal who was ill, he recovered, but saw no evil in her.

witnesses.name: Zabel fille de feu Nicolas le Comte
witnesses.testimony_summary: Father believed she and husband bewitched him to death after lawsuit lost. Heard them quarrelling. Terrified by noise in stable night after warning of arrest.

witnesses.name: Demenge Guanat
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation 7 years.

witnesses.name: Jean Purel du chauffour de Flin
witnesses.testimony_summary: Heard her say she had languished 14-15 years, supposed she meant reputation as witch.

witnesses.name: Jean Mareschal
witnesses.testimony_summary: Painful knee 17 years ago, cured by soup made with bread/salt/yeast from her house. She asked to be warned of arrest so they could flee.

witnesses.name: Nicolas Moictrier
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation; no action after public accusation by Claudine, servant of Messire Jean Chatton.

witnesses.name: Jehenne femme Nicolas Mengeotte
witnesses.testimony_summary: Horse strayed behind her house 18 months ago, she approached it, died next day after behaving wildly in stable.

witnesses.name: Claude femme Jean Symon
witnesses.testimony_summary: First husband Didier Symonin died after 4 years. Heard Mengette said witness was too comfortable and she envied her. Suspected Mengette if she was witch.

witnesses.name: Nicolas fils feu Estienne Prieur
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation only.

witnesses.name: Jehenne fille feu Estienne Prieur
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation only.

witnesses.name: Nicolas du Martinbois
witnesses.testimony_summary: Borrowed cart 3 years ago, hay fell off mysteriously, she appeared and told them off. Lost use of right side 2 years, suspected her because he testified against mother.

witnesses.name: Nicolas Masson
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation only.

witnesses.name: Jean Thieriat
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation only.

witnesses.name: Sebille femme Jean Thieriat
witnesses.testimony_summary: Husband ended ploughing arrangement with Jean Cachette 15 years ago. Horse attacked by wolf 8 days later, died. Suspected she took form of wolf.

witnesses.name: Sabel femme Nicolas Hanry
witnesses.testimony_summary: Serious illness 3 years ago, cured by soup with bread/salt/butter from accused's house. Cat tried to attack her and son, believed it was Mengette in cat form.

witnesses.name: Jehenne veuve Jean Margueron
witnesses.testimony_summary: Corroborated daughter's (witness 39) story about cat attack.

witnesses.name: Jehenne femme Nicolas Martinbois
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation only.

witnesses.name: Chrestienne femme Jean Grand Jean
witnesses.testimony_summary: Refused milk, told she'd remember. Butter spilt on fire 4-5 days later. Ill 6 weeks 5 years later, cured by plums then apples from Mengette.

witnesses.name: Jennon femme Claudon Hursieu
witnesses.testimony_summary: Son Demenge became simple-minded after illness. Horse killed, believed she took form of wolf.

witnesses.name: Alison femme Nicolas Gerardin
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation since mother's arrest.

witnesses.name: Jehenne femme Estienne Saigeant
witnesses.testimony_summary: Daughter Jennon told off by Mengette over father's lawsuit. Daughter became swollen, unable to speak since Christmas.

witnesses.name: Pieron Purel
witnesses.testimony_summary: Trouble with her children 5 years ago. Became ill 5-6 weeks, recovered after eating 3 eggs she sent.

witnesses.name: Jean Cachette le saulnier
witnesses.testimony_summary: Lost animals from envy. First wife died of strange illness, claimed Mengette gave it at funeral of her father. Second wife ill 14 weeks after marriage, not invited to feast.

witnesses.name: Claudon femme Jean Cachette
witnesses.testimony_summary: Ill after drinking from cruche Mengette drank from. Ill 14 weeks, Mengette visited, touched knees, recovered. Showed marks under knees to court.

witnesses.name: George Mengeotte
witnesses.testimony_summary: Reputation only.

witnesses.name: Didie femme Jean Purel du chauffour de Flin
witnesses.testimony_summary: Husband ill, suspected three women tried to strangle him. Claudon veuve Demenge Demengeon gave cure recipe: cake made with flour and husband's urine, worked.

timeline.subject: Mengette Cachette
timeline.details: Substitut for PG de Lorraine at Lunéville authorized production of witnesses

timeline.subject: Mengette Cachette
timeline.details: Taken by Symon Charier, maître echevin

timeline.subject: Mengette Cachette
timeline.details: Substitut orders her arrest and interrogation

timeline.subject: Mengette Cachette
timeline.details: Substitut for PG asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Mengette Cachette
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - withstood thumbscrews, confessed on rack

timeline.subject: Mengette Cachette
timeline.details: Substitut for PG asks for execution

timeline.subject: Mengette Cachette
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approved death sentence

timeline.subject: Mengette Cachette
timeline.details: Definitive sentence from court at Azerailles

accomplices_named.name: Jean Cachette (husband)
accomplices_named.context: Named during torture, said he was witch and she had seen him at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Sister of hermit of Flin
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat, complained about being poorly viewed

accomplices_named.name: Claudon Plaisance
accomplices_named.context: Herdsman, recognized at sabbat by voice though masked, refused to harm crops because had children to feed

prior_accusations.context: Mother had been imprisoned at Azerailles for witchcraft, Mengette feared she would also be arrested

relationships.evidence_text: first wife Alix had been sister of Jean Cachette
upbraided her father Jean de Glonville

third_parties.name: Laurence
third_parties.context: Mother of Mengette, had been imprisoned at Azerailles for witchcraft, left after arrest

third_parties.name: Fleuratte daughter of Mengette
third_parties.context: Sent with grease to Demenge Purel's wife

third_parties.name: Jehenne daughter of Mengette
third_parties.context: Aged 18, told story 8 years before of going to wood with mother and grandmother where they danced with calves and black dogs

third_parties.name: Bartremin son of Mengette
third_parties.context: Taken into service by Anthoine Vannier, sent home as unsuitable after a week

third_parties.name: Gerardin Cachette
third_parties.context: Father-in-law, selling horses to take mortmain

third_parties.name: Prior of Meraville
third_parties.context: Brother of accused, instigated her to enquire if mother had confessed

third_parties.name: Claudine servant to Jean Chatton
third_parties.context: Called her witch publicly, no redress sought

third_parties.name: Jean Marchal, lieutenant of prévôt
third_parties.context: Told Jean Vannier that during mother's imprisonment Mengette asked to be warned of bad news so she and husband could flee

third_parties.name: Symon Charier
third_parties.context: Maître echevin in prévôté of Azerailles who took informations preparatoires

third_parties.name: Messire Demenge Bollengier
third_parties.context: Priest at Flin, won lawsuit over chapel

third_parties.name: Claudon veuve Demenge Demengeon
third_parties.context: Of Flin, gave cure recipe using cake made with urine

third_parties.name: Sabel wife of maire Hanry of Hardonviller
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: sister (according to dying Nicolas le Comte)
third_parties.context: Named by dying Nicolas le Comte as having bewitched him along with Mengette and Jean Cachatte

confession_details.narrative: Husband beat her saying everyone called her witch, making him dishonored. Went to lament behind house, Persin approached and promised happiness, no more beatings. Seduction occurred, no sexual element. Gave black powder to kill, white to cure, and money that turned to horse-dung. Returned next week, beat her when she refused compliance. She used powder on their own horse which died despite trying to cure it. Persin told her not to confess, said he'd bear pain, had been in throat but left when she drank holy water. Admitted killing Fleuratte femme Jean de Glonville because she had palliage where women spun and wouldn't make place for her - threw black powder on her while sitting on cairalle Sunday afternoon. Made cousin Nicolas Hanry's wife ill then cured her because children called her witch. Attended sabbat but didn't dance because lame - others called her Beccesse and langarde, said she'd cause them to be discovered. At sabbat: great devil on horse received adoration, told them to take vengeance. Dancing around table with bagpipe/cornemuse, then banquet without bread/wine/salt, mostly beef, thrown piece separately. All wore masks resembling muzzles, hers was leather. Master brought mask, took it after sabbat. Transported in cloud/fog embraced by master, arrived quickly. Devils valued rich over poor, beautiful over ugly.

legal_context.redress_outcome: Several witnesses mention she was called witch publicly but took no legal action, witnesses said some accusers were too poor to make suing worthwhile

emotional_state_notes: After confession said 'bien joyeuse et contante d'avoir confessé son cas'
Said she endured such fascherie from master and husband that 'elle aymoit mieulx mourir que vivre'
Said 'qu'elle n'estoit pas saige' about statement of fleeing

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Jean de Glonville and wife imprisoned at château of Deneuvre over baggage of Nicolas Choian
Mother of witness not to be believed, imprisoned in château of Deneuvre for theft
Sabel fille Nicolas le Comte was ribaulde who made pleasure for priests and companions, though she defended herself
Nicolas Harman stole flax seed from Jean Cachette le saulnier, found in his chest in church
Jean Cachette le saulnier was thief, 7 pieces de couvrechef found in his house
Claudon femme Jean Cachette was ribaude who abandoned husband 2-3 times
Didié femme Jean Purel arrested for theft of cloth

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial with 50 witnesses producing extensive testimony. Multiple patterns evident: reputation spanning 10-30 years, many cases of animal deaths (especially horses) following quarrels or admiration, pattern of illness followed by cure using food from accused's house (bread/salt/yeast/butter), multiple reports of shape-shifting (wolf, cat). Confession obtained under torture (rack) after withstanding thumbscrews. Named accomplices but later retracted charges against husband. Change de Nancy approved both torture and death sentence. Many witnesses reported only reputation. Economic context shows poverty, disputes over animals, ploughing arrangements, and inheritance. Mother Laurence previously imprisoned for witchcraft. Testimony summaries condensed due to volume; some details of specific quarrels and circumstances abbreviated for length constraints.
